intro: Nothocnide, commonly known as the false chamaedorea, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Araceae. These plants are characterized by their tropical origin and are native to regions in Central and South America. They typically have a rhizomatous growth habit, with a stout, upright stem and broad, lance-shaped leaves. The flowers are small and clustered in an inflorescence called a spadix, which is enclosed by a modified leaf called a spathe. Nothocnide species are often cultivated as ornamental plants due to their attractive foliage and ability to thrive in shaded environments.
